meanings.definition: A device used to launch objects through the air.
meanings.sent1: The catapults at the fair launched small balls into the air.
meanings.sent2: The ancient army used catapults to hurl rocks at the enemy.
meanings.sent3: The catapults in the game were so powerful, they could launch characters across the screen.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a catapults, spreading joy through the room.
meanings.sent5: The catapults in the story were magical, able to launch people into different worlds.

meanings.definition: To launch or throw something with great force.
meanings.sent1: He catapults the ball across the field with all his might.
meanings.sent2: The pitcher catapults the baseball towards the batter.
meanings.sent3: She catapults her ideas into the conversation, making everyone pay attention.
meanings.sent4: The storm catapults raindrops against the window, creating a soothing sound.
meanings.sent5: The rocket catapults into space, leaving a trail of fire behind.
